thread.title: Crimson claim 13th straight Ivy win
thread.title_full: Crimson claim 13th straight Ivy win | Boston Herald

author: Herald Staff
title: Crimson claim 13th straight Ivy win
text:
Scott Hosch threw three touchdown passes and ran for another score and Harvard beat Cornell 40-3 yesterday to win its 18th straight game at Ithaca, N.Y.
The Crimson (4-0, 2-0 Ivy League) outgained Cornell (0-4, 0-2) 499 total yards to 192 and converted one of three interceptions and a fumble into scores.
Hosch was 14-of-30 for 244 yards, with TD strikes of 47 yards to Ben Braunecker, 19 yards to Anthony Firkser and 46 yards to Justice Shelton-Mosely. Hosch also scored on a 3-yard run in the fourth quarter.
Paul Stanton Jr. gained 101 yards on 17 carries and scored on a 2-yard run.
The Crimson defense held Big Red leading rusher Luke Hagy to 33 yards on 15 carries and Luke Hutton, Eric Ryan and Jordan Becerra each grabbed interceptions.
The victory is Harvard’s 13th consecutive Ivy League win and 10th straight win over Cornell dating back to 2006.
Dartmouth 35, Yale 3 — Dalyn Williams passed for a career-high 435 yards and four touchdowns to help the Big Green (4-0, 2-0) remain undefeated with an Ivy League win over the Bulldogs (3-1, 1-1) in Hanover, N.H.
Williams became Dartmouth’s career leader in total offense (7,525), passing former NFL quarterback Jay Fiedler (1991-93). Williams moved past Brian Mann into second on the school’s all-time passing list with 6,080 yards, trailing only Fiedler (6,684).
Maine 39, Albany 7 — Dan Collins and Drew Belcher of Reading combined for four touchdowns, leading the Black Bears (2-3, 2-1) to a Colonial Athletic Association win over the Great Danes (2-4, 1-2) in Albany, N.Y.
Collins led Maine on three first-quarter touchdown drives, building a 20-0 lead. Belcher played mostly mop-up duty, throwing touchdown passes in the third and fourth quarter to Micah Wright and Jaleel Reed, respectively. Collins was 21-of-28 for 208 yards with a rushing and passing touchdown, and Belcher was 7-of-8 for 75 yards.
Brown 25, Holy Cross 24 — Grant Senne kicked a 35-yard field goal with 2:06 left to help the Bears (2-2) beat the Crusaders (2-3) in Worcester.
Senne’s kick capped an 11-play, 63-yard drive — the big play coming on a 14-yard completion from Marcus Fuller to Alexander Jette on third-and-6 to the Holy Cross 24.
Fuller was 33-of-50 for 412 yards. Jette had 16 catches for 216 yards — both career highs. Troy Doles added nine catches for 112 yards.
Rhode Island 20, Delaware 0 — Harold Cooper ran for a career-best 123 yards and a touchdown and the Rams (1-5, 1-2) picked up their first victory of the season with a 20-0 Colonial Athletic Association win over the Blue Hens (2-4, 1-2) in Kingston, R.I.
The Rams posted their first shutout since a 3-0 win over Maine in 2006, 100 games ago. It was also Rhode Island’s first win in the series since 2011.
Central Connecticut State 35, Bryant 33 — Cameron Nash had 104 yards receiving, 102 in kickoff returns, 90 rushing and a touchdown to lift the Blue Devils (2-4, 1-1) past the Bulldogs (2-3, 0-1) in a Northeast Conference game at Mansfield, Conn.
Sacred Heart 26, Robert Morris 13 — R.J. Noel passed for one touchdown and ran for another, and the Pioneers (3-2, 1-0) forced eight turnovers to defeat Colonials (2-4, 1-1) in this Northeast Conference game at Moon Township, Pa.
UConn 40, UCF 13 — Bryan Shirreffs threw for 256 yards and a touchdown and ran for another score and the Huskies (3-3, 1-1) snapped a three-game losing streak with a American Athletic Conference victory over the Knights (0-6,0-2) in Orlando, Fla.
AIC 14, Stonehill 6 — Maurice Easterling had TD jaunts of 70 and 57 yards on his 181 rushing yards for the Yellow Jackets (3-3, 3-2) during this Northeast-10 win over the Skyhawks (4-2, 3-2) in Easton.
Bentley 19, Saint Anselm 14 — George Craan of Hyde Park and Concord-Carlisle finished a six-play, 91-yard drive with a 2-yard touchdown run at :44 to play in the Falcons (3-3, 3-2 NE-10) victory over the Hawks (2-4, 2-3) in Waltham.
LIU Post 27, Merrimack 24 — Jeff Kidd threw for three touchdowns to overcome the three interceptions he threw during this Northeast-10 win by the Pioneers (4-2, 3-2 NE-10) over the Warriors (2-4, 2-3 NE-10) in Brookville, N.Y.
Tufts 43, Bowdoin 24 — Chance Brady rushed for 123 yards and three touchdowns on 14 carries as the Jumbos improved to 3-0 with this Division 3 win over the Polar Bears (0-3) in Somerville.
Framingham State 35, Westfield State 7 — Matt Silva of Dracut was 19-of-26 passing for 212 yards and three touchdowns as the Rams (5-1, 4-0 MASCAC) thumped the Owls (1-4, 0-3) in Westfield.
Fitchburg State 23, Worcester State 0 — Garrett Dellechiale threw for three touchdowns among his 294 yards as the Falcons (5-1, 3-1 MASCAC) blanked the Lancers (0-5, 0-3) in Fitchburg.
